title: When are the 2025 local elections and who can vote?
description: Voters in parts of England will elect councillors and mayors on 1 May.

title: Counter-terrorism police investigating Kneecap videos
description: The Metropolitan Police say there are 'grounds for further investigation' into the videos.

title: Bin dispute goes to May Day mediation talks
description: The talks on Thursday will see conciliation service Acas included in negotiations for the first time.

title: 'Unacceptable' to question Supreme Court gender ruling, says minister
description: Shabana Mahmood said judges at the UK's highest court had provided "legal clarity".

title: When are the 2025 local elections and who can vote?
description: Voters in parts of England will elect councillors and mayors on 1 May.

title: Labour defends net-zero policies after Blair criticism
description: Former PM Sir Tony Blair says limiting fossil fuels is "doomed to fail" and a new approach is needed.

title: MPs watchdog probes Reeves' theatre tickets declaration
description: The BBC has been told the chancellor accepted a donation but did not add it to the MPs' register of interests.

title: Counter-terrorism police investigating Kneecap videos
description: The Metropolitan Police say there are 'grounds for further investigation' into the videos.

title: Badenoch accuses government of failure on grooming gangs
description: The government has been facing growing demands to reveal which areas are running grooming gang inquires.

title: Government not taking climate seriously - advisers
description: The government has made little progress in preparing the UK for rising temperatures, climate watchdog the CCC says.

title: Sex offenders to be denied asylum rights in new law
description: Asylum seekers placed on the sex offenders register will be denied the right to stay in the UK.

title: Milkshakes and lattes could be covered by sugar tax
description: The tax would be applied to manufacturers of milk-based drinks and dairy-based substitutes, under the plans.

title: What photo ID will you need to vote in the local elections?
description: Everyone voting in person in the May local elections in England must show valid photo ID.

title: Is there a local election in my area and where can I vote?
description: Find out whether there is an election near you on Thursday and where you can vote, using our lookup tool.

title: Who's standing in the Runcorn by-election?
description: A total of 15 people are vying to be the next MP for Runcorn and Helsby in Cheshire.

title: Watch: What's at stake in these local elections?

title: Is Welsh Labour turning away from Keir Starmer?
description: Could frustrations between Welsh and UK Labour boil over, asks political editor Gareth Lewis.
